meanings.definition: In a way that is not practical or feasible.
meanings.sent1: She tried to carry all the groceries home impractically, dropping them along the way.
meanings.sent2: He knew it was impractically to expect to finish all the work in one day.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb the tree impractically, only to get stuck halfway up.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to build a house of cards was impractically ambitious.
meanings.sent5: The idea of traveling to Mars by bicycle is impractically absurd.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is not sensible or realistic.
meanings.sent1: He spoke impractically about flying to the moon without a spaceship.
meanings.sent2: The decision to go on a road trip without a map was impractically risky.
meanings.sent3: She tried to bake a cake without an oven, which was impractically silly.
meanings.sent4: His dream of becoming a superhero was impractically far-fetched.
meanings.sent5: The idea of swimming across the ocean is impractically dangerous.
